value.title: SoftBank's Chip Designer Arm Extends Gains After $65 Billion Nasdaq Debut
value.excerpt: (Reuters) - Shares of SoftBank's Arm Holdings rose before the bell on Friday, extending gains from a stellar Nasdaq debut that valued the British chip designer at $65 billion, in a relief to the U.S. IPO market facing a drought in listings.

value.title: Shares of AI chip designer Arm jump 25% after largest IPO in nearly two years
value.excerpt: After a nearly two-year drought in the IPO market, UK-based chip designer Arm made a successful Nasdaq debut on Thursday, finishing the day 25% higher and landing the company with a market cap of around $65 billion.

value.title: AI language models need to shrink; here’s why smaller may be better
value.excerpt: Large language models (LLMs) used for generative AI tools can consume vast amounts of processor cycles and be costly to use. Smaller, more industry- or business-tailored models can often provide better results tailored to business needs.

value.title: Siri and Apple’s AI Moves
